title: Beef Tallow May Soon Show Up On a Menu Near You. Here's What That Means
snippets: Beef tallow, a form of beef fat, is becoming increasingly popular in restaurants and food products, including at Steak 'n Shake. It is praised for its flavor and potential health benefits, despite nutritionists' recommendations for seed oils due to their lower saturated fat content. Technomic reports mentions of tallow on menus rose over 40% recently, and it's expected to feature on 8% of restaurant menus in four years. However, it remains less common than seed oils, used in less than 1% of menus currently. Health concerns about saturated fats in animal products persist, but tallow is seen as
summary: Beef tallow is gaining popularity in restaurants and food products for its flavor and potential health benefits, with mentions on menus increasing over 40% recently. Despite nutritionists' preference for seed oils due to lower saturated fat, tallow is expected to be on 8% of restaurant menus in four years, up from less than 1% currently. However, health concerns regarding saturated fats in animal products continue.
